name: Taiyuan
title: Taiyuan - Traveling China like your home yard
overview: Taiyuan is the capital of Shanxi Province, with a history dating back over 2,500 years. Known as an important industrial and cultural center, Taiyuan offers historic temples, museums, and serves as a gateway to famous Buddhist sites like Mount Wutai and the ancient city of Pingyao.

highlights.attractions: Jinci Temple, Twin Pagoda Temple, Shanxi Museum, Fen River Park
highlights.cuisine: Shanxi Vinegar Dishes, Knife-cut Noodles, Youmian (Oat Noodles), Lamb Soup
highlights.bestTime: Spring (April-May) and Autumn (September-October) with mild weather

dishes.name: Shanxi Vinegar Dishes
dishes.description: Local dishes featuring the famous aged Shanxi vinegar as a key ingredient.

dishes.name: Taiyuan Knife-cut Noodles
dishes.description: Hand-cut noodles with unique texture, served with various sauces.

dishes.name: Youmian (Oat Noodles)
dishes.description: Traditional oat noodles, a specialty of northern Shanxi.

foodStreets.name: Food Street
foodStreets.description: Popular area with traditional Shanxi cuisine and local specialties.

foodStreets.name: Old Town Area
foodStreets.description: Historic district with local restaurants serving authentic dishes.

gettingThere: By Air: Taiyuan Wusu International Airport (TYN) with domestic flights
By Train: High-speed rail connects Taiyuan to Beijing and other major cities
By Bus: Long-distance bus services from neighboring provinces
gettingAround: Metro: Modern subway system under development
Walking: Best way to explore historic areas and parks
